text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/09c569038c42dcbdaa5c9b35fc9d1afbe5072cb4|patch 8.2.0466: not parsing messages recursively breaks the govim plugin>
patch 8.2.0466: not parsing messages recursively breaks the govim plugin

Problem:    Not parsing messages recursively breaks the govim plugin.
Solution:   When called recursively do handle messages but do not close
            channels.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0466: not parsing messages recursively breaks the govim plugin · vim/vim@09c5690
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0466: not parsing messages recursively breaks the govim plugin · vim/vim@09c5690
attachments.text: Problem: Not parsing messages recursively breaks the govim plugin. Solution: When called recursively do handle messages but do not close channels.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/7c003aa314337ce732e18c541fa93d71cafedf03|patch 8.2.0468: GUI: pixel dust with some fonts and characters>
patch 8.2.0468: GUI: pixel dust with some fonts and characters

Problem:    GUI: pixel dust with some fonts and characters.
Solution:   Always redraw the character before the cursor. (Nir Lichtman,
            closes #5549, closes #5856)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0468: GUI: pixel dust with some fonts and characters · vim/vim@7c003aa
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0468: GUI: pixel dust with some fonts and characters · vim/vim@7c003aa
attachments.text: Problem: GUI: pixel dust with some fonts and characters. Solution: Always redraw the character before the cursor. (Nir Lichtman, closes #5549, closes #5856)

patch 8.2.0470: Test_confirm_cmd_cancel() can fail on a slow system

Solution:   Use WaitForAssert(). (Ozaki Kiichi, closes #5861)

patch 8.2.0473: variables declared in an outer scope

Problem:    Variables declared in an outer scope.
Solution:   Decleare variables only in the scope where they are used.

attachments.title: patch 8.2.0473: variables declared in an outer scope · vim/vim@8601545

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/0fff44152d06e6b662ad4bef172af07a041d2f3f|patch 8.2.0474: cannot use :write when using a plugin with BufWriteCmd>
patch 8.2.0474: cannot use :write when using a plugin with BufWriteCmd

Problem:    Cannot use :write when using a plugin with BufWriteCmd.
Solution:   Reset BF_NOTEDITED after BufWriteCmd. (closes #5807)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0474: cannot use :write when using a plugin with BufWriteCmd · vim/vim@0fff441
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0474: cannot use :write when using a plugin with BufWriteCmd · vim/vim@0fff441
attachments.text: Problem: Cannot use :write when using a plugin with BufWriteCmd. Solution: Reset BF_NOTEDITED after BufWriteCmd. (closes #5807)

patch 8.2.0475: channel out_cb test still fails sometimes on Mac

Solution:   Use an ever longer timeout.
